block.p: Flora Wei-Chun Feng, the daughter of Natalie and Dan-Ho Feng of Taipei, Taiwan, was married Friday to Jeffrey Andres Slater, the son of Carmen Slater and Alfred Slater Jr. of Geneva. The Rev. Vernon C. Nichols, a Unitarian-Universalist minister, officiated at Atlantica, a restaurant in Westhampton Beach, N.Y.
The bride, a graduate of M.I.T., and the bridegroom, who graduated from Pomona College, received law degrees from Georgetown, where they met.

Flora Wei-Chun Feng, the daughter of Natalie and Dan-Ho Feng of Taipei, Taiwan, was married Friday to Jeffrey Andres Slater, the son of Carmen Slater and Alfred Slater Jr. of Geneva. The Rev. Vernon C. Nichols, a Unitarian-Universalist minister, officiated at Atlantica, a restaurant in Westhampton Beach, N.Y.
The bride, a graduate of M.I.T., and the bridegroom, who graduated from Pomona College, received law degrees from Georgetown, where they met.

The bride, 31, is keeping her name. She is to become an associate next month in the New York office of Mintz, Levin, Cohn, Ferris, Glovsky & Popeo, a Boston law firm. Her father, a civil engineer, retired as a project manager for the Metropolitan Transportation Authority. Her mother, a molecular biologist, is retired from the Brookhaven National Laboratories in Upton, N.Y. They both now work in Taiwan, the bride's father as an engineering consultant at the Hi-Vast International Railway Consultancy and Engineering Company and her mother as a vice president for marketing at Synzyme Asia Biotechnology.

The bridegroom, 29, is an employee compensation specialist with the United Nations Development Program in New York. His father is the director of human resources at the World Health Organization in Geneva.
